intro: Cnidoscolus peruvianus, commonly known as the Peruvian arrowhead, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, spiny stems. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in moist, humid environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's unique morphology makes it both ornamental and ecologically significant in its native habitat.
